info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 24 at 10:22AM CDT until April 27 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Des Moines IA
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Des Moines IA has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Iowa...
Black Hawk Creek at Hudson affecting Black Hawk county.
* WHAT...Flooding is possible.
* WHERE...The Black Hawk Creek at Hudson, or from the Black Hawk-Grundy County line to the Cedar River in Waterloo.
* WHEN...From late Friday night to Sunday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Water affects Watters Rd. Some residential evacuations may be needed. Water also affects Ridgeway Ave at US 63 in Waterloo.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 10.4 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings.
For the latest waterway observations and forecasts refer to weather.gov/desmoines/water.
River forecasts include observed precipitation plus forecast precipitation over the next 24 hours. There is uncertainty on rainfall location and amounts over the next 24 hours. Therefore, a flood watch has been issued.

parameter.value: FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT TO SUNDAY MORNING
